presidents.name: George Washington
presidents.quote: Discipline is the soul of an army.
presidents.description: You lead through quiet authority and principled consistency. Like Washington, you build consensus through patience, set high standards through personal example, and prefer deliberation over haste. You're the steady anchor in turbulent times — people follow you because they trust your character and judgment. Your consistency and integrity make you the person others turn to when things get uncertain.

presidents.name: Thomas Jefferson
presidents.quote: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
presidents.description: You're driven by big ideas and deep convictions. Like Jefferson, you prefer working behind the scenes — writing, building arguments, and influencing through one-on-one dialogue rather than public spectacle. You take bold positions on principle but communicate them with care and precision. Your ideas outlast your presence in the room, and you'd rather craft the perfect argument than deliver the perfect speech.

presidents.name: Abraham Lincoln
presidents.quote: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
presidents.description: You combine values-driven purpose with practical wisdom. Like Lincoln, you listen deeply, include opposing voices, and then speak truth simply and directly. You're willing to take bold action when principles are at stake, but you build coalitions rather than issue commands. People trust you because you mean exactly what you say — your authenticity and humility make your convictions even more powerful.

presidents.name: Theodore Roosevelt
presidents.quote: Get action. Do things; be sane; don't fritter away your time.
presidents.description: You attack life with infectious energy and iron will. Like TR, you make decisions quickly, take big risks with confidence, and lead from the front. Your directness cuts through complexity, and your enthusiasm mobilizes everyone around you. You're willing to break norms and test boundaries because you believe momentum beats perfection. When you enter a room, things start happening.

presidents.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
presidents.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
presidents.description: You combine personal warmth with fearless experimentation. Like FDR, you're socially magnetic, willing to take massive risks, and focused relentlessly on what actually works. You build diverse coalitions through charm and connection, and you're unafraid to try bold approaches when circumstances demand it. Your optimism and flexibility turn crises into opportunities — you make people believe in possibility.

presidents.name: Ronald Reagan
presidents.quote: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.
presidents.description: You lead through vision, warmth, and communication skill. Like Reagan, you're socially gifted, decisive on big issues, and able to make complex ideas feel simple and inspiring. You balance bold conviction with pragmatic deal-making, and your confidence helps you build coalitions even with skeptics. Your greatest strength is making people feel good about where you're headed.

presidents.name: Bill Clinton
presidents.quote: There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
presidents.description: You thrive on human connection and excel at finding workable solutions. Like Clinton, you can make anyone feel like the most important person in the room. You're extraordinarily social, read people exceptionally well, and focus on outcomes over ideology. You build bridges between opposing camps and master the art of the possible — your empathy and adaptability make you effective in any setting.

presidents.name: George W. Bush
presidents.quote: I know it's hard for you to believe, but I have not doubted.
presidents.description: You trust your instincts and aren't afraid to make tough calls. Like Bush, you lead with clear conviction, communicate with straightforward plainness, and take bold action even when it's unpopular. You favor clarity and decisiveness over extended deliberation. You build fierce loyalty through personal warmth and directness, and you stand firm behind your decisions while valuing integrity above popularity.

presidents.name: Barack Obama
presidents.quote: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.
presidents.description: You lead with intellectual rigor and measured temperament. Like Obama, you process complexity thoroughly, seek diverse input, and make principled decisions with care. Your calm presence commands respect, and you communicate with polish and precision. You're strategic about when to engage and prefer careful reasoning over force. Your deliberation reflects seriousness, not hesitation — you'd rather be rigorous than rushed.

presidents.name: Donald Trump
presidents.quote: I like thinking big. If you're going to be thinking anything, you might as well think big.
presidents.description: You're a decisive force who leads personally and acts quickly. Like Trump, you take massive risks, communicate with unfiltered directness, and prefer action over extended deliberation. You challenge conventional wisdom, break through gridlock with high intensity, and prioritize results over process. Your directness is your brand — you make calls with minimal delay and aren't constrained by precedent or convention.
